Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/fpif.c

1/* mpfr_fpif -- Binary export & import of MPFR numbers
2 (floating-point interchange format)
3
4Copyright 2012-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
5Contributed by Olivier Demengeon.
6
7This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
8
9The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
10it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
11the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12option) any later version.
13
14The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
15WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
16or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
17License for more details.
18
19You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
20along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
21http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2251 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
23
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26#if !defined (HAVE_BIG_ENDIAN) && !defined (HAVE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
27#error "Endianness is unknown. Not supported yet."
28#endif
29
30/* The format is described as follows. Any multi-byte number is encoded
31 in little endian.
32
33 1. We first store the precision p (this format is able to represent
34 any precision from 1 to 2^64 + 248).
35 Let B be the first byte (0 <= B <= 255).
36 * If B >= 8, the precision p is B-7.
37 Here, the condition is equivalent to 1 <= p <= 248.
38 * If B <= 7, the next B+1 bytes contain p-249.
39 Here, the condition is equivalent to 249 <= p <= 2^64 + 248.
40 We will use the following macros:
41 * MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE = 7
42 * MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION = 255 - 7 = 248
43
44 2. Then we store the sign bit and exponent related information
45 (possibly a special value). We first have byte A = [seeeeeee],
46 where s is the sign bit and E = [eeeeeee] such that:
47 * If 0 <= E <= 94, then the exponent e is E-47 (-47 <= e <= 47).
48 * If 95 <= E <= 110, the exponent is stored in the next E-94 bytes
49 (1 to 16 bytes) in sign + absolute value representation.
50 * If 111 <= E <= 118, the exponent size S is stored in the next
51 E-110 bytes (1 to 8), then the exponent itself is stored in the
52 next S bytes. [Not implemented yet]
53 * If 119 <= E <= 127, we have a special value:
54 E = 119 (MPFR_KIND_ZERO) for a signed zero;
55 E = 120 (MPFR_KIND_INF) for a signed infinity;
56 E = 121 (MPFR_KIND_NAN) for NaN.
57
58 3. Then we store the significand (for regular values).
59
60 The sign bit is preserved by the import/export functions, even for NaN.
61
62 Note: When a size is stored, it must be minimal, i.e. a number cannot
63 start with a null byte. Otherwise the import may fail.
64*/
65
66#define MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE 7
67#define MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION (255 - MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE)
68
69#define MPFR_KIND_ZERO 119
70#define MPFR_KIND_INF 120
71#define MPFR_KIND_NAN 121
72#define MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT 47
73#define MPFR_EXTERNAL_EXPONENT 94
74
75/* Begin: Low level helper functions */
76
77/* storage must have an unsigned type */
78#define COUNT_NB_BYTE(storage, size) \
79 do \
80 { \
81 (storage) >>= 8; \
82 (size)++; \
83 } \
84 while ((storage) != 0)
85
86#define ALLOC_RESULT(buffer, buffer_size, wanted_size) \
87 do \
88 { \
89 if ((buffer) == NULL || *(buffer_size) < (wanted_size)) \
90 { \
91 (buffer) = (unsigned char *) mpfr_reallocate_func \
92 ((buffer), *(buffer_size), (wanted_size)); \
93 if ((buffer) == NULL) \
94 { \
95 *(buffer_size) = 0; \
96 return NULL; \
97 } \
98 } \
99 *(buffer_size) = (wanted_size); \
100 } \
101 while (0)
102
103/*
104 * size in byte of a MPFR number in a binary object of a variable size
105 */
106#define MAX_VARIABLE_STORAGE(exponent_size, precision) \
107 ((size_t)(((precision) >> 3) + (exponent_size) + \
108 ((precision) > 248 ? sizeof(mpfr_prec_t) : 0) + 3))
109
110/* copy in result[] the values in data[] with a different endianness,
111 where data_size might be smaller than data_max_size, so that we only
112 copy data_size bytes from the end of data[]. */
113static void
114#if defined (HAVE_BIG_ENDIAN)
115putLittleEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
116 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
117#elif defined (HAVE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
118putBigEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
119 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
120#endif
121{
122 size_t j;
123
124 MPFR_ASSERTD (data_size <= data_max_size);
125 for (j = 0; j < data_size; j++)
126 result[j] = data[data_max_size - j - 1];
127}
128
129/* copy in result[] the values in data[] with the same endianness */
130static void
131#if defined (HAVE_BIG_ENDIAN)
132putBigEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
133 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
134#elif defined (HAVE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
135putLittleEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
136 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
137#endif
138{
139 MPFR_ASSERTD (data_size <= data_max_size);
140 memcpy (result, data, data_size);
141}
142
143/* copy in result[] the values in data[] with a different endianness;
144 the data are written at the end of the result[] buffer (if
145 data_size < data_max_size, the first bytes of result[] are
146 left untouched). */
147static void
148#if defined (HAVE_BIG_ENDIAN)
149getLittleEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
150 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
151#elif defined (HAVE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
152getBigEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
153 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
154#endif
155{
156 size_t j;
157
158 MPFR_ASSERTD (data_size <= data_max_size);
159 for (j = 0; j < data_size; j++)
160 result[data_max_size - j - 1] = data[j];
161}
162
163/* copy in result[] the values in data[] with the same endianness */
164static void
165#if defined (HAVE_BIG_ENDIAN)
166getBigEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
167 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
168#elif defined (HAVE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
169getLittleEndianData (unsigned char *result, unsigned char *data,
170 size_t data_max_size, size_t data_size)
171#endif
172{
173 MPFR_ASSERTD (data_size <= data_max_size);
174 memcpy (result, data, data_size);
175}
176
177/* End: Low level helper functions */
178
179/* Internal Function */
180/*
181 * buffer : OUT : store the precision in binary format, can be null
182 * (may be reallocated if too small)
183 * buffer_size : IN/OUT : size of the buffer => size used in the buffer
184 * precision : IN : precision to store
185 * return pointer to a buffer storing the precision in binary format
186 */
187static unsigned char *
188mpfr_fpif_store_precision (unsigned char *buffer, size_t *buffer_size,
189 mpfr_prec_t precision)
190{
191 unsigned char *result;
192 size_t size_precision;
193
194 MPFR_ASSERTD (precision >= 1);
195 size_precision = 0;
196
197 if (precision > MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION)
198 {
199 mpfr_uprec_t copy_precision;
200
201 copy_precision = precision - (MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION + 1);
202 COUNT_NB_BYTE(copy_precision, size_precision);
203 }
204
205 result = buffer;
206 ALLOC_RESULT(result, buffer_size, size_precision + 1);
207
208 if (precision > MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION)
209 {
210 result[0] = size_precision - 1;
211 precision -= (MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION + 1);
212 putLittleEndianData (result + 1, (unsigned char *) &precision,
213 sizeof(mpfr_prec_t), size_precision);
214 }
215 else
216 result[0] = precision + MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE;
217
218 return result;
219}
220
221#define BUFFER_SIZE 8
222
223/*
224 * fh : IN : file handler
225 * return the precision stored in the binary buffer, 0 in case of error
226 */
227static mpfr_prec_t
228mpfr_fpif_read_precision_from_file (FILE *fh)
229{
230 mpfr_prec_t precision;
231 size_t precision_size;
232 unsigned char buffer[BUFFER_SIZE];
233
234 if (fh == NULL)
235 return 0;
236
237 if (fread (buffer, 1, 1, fh) != 1)
238 return 0;
239
240 precision_size = buffer[0];
241 if (precision_size > MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE)
242 return precision_size - MPFR_MAX_PRECSIZE;
243
244 precision_size++;
245 MPFR_ASSERTD (precision_size <= BUFFER_SIZE);
246
247 /* Read the precision in little-endian format. */
248 if (fread (buffer, precision_size, 1, fh) != 1)
249 return 0;
250
251 while (precision_size > sizeof(mpfr_prec_t))
252 {
253 if (buffer[precision_size-1] != 0)
254 return 0; /* the read precision doesn't fit in a mpfr_prec_t */
255 precision_size--;
256 }
257
258 if (precision_size == sizeof(mpfr_prec_t) &&
259 buffer[precision_size-1] >= 0x80)
260 return 0; /* the read precision doesn't fit in a mpfr_prec_t */
261
262 precision = 0; /* to pad with 0's if data_size < data_max_size */
263
264 /* On big-endian machines, the data must be copied at the end of the
265 precision object in the memory; thus data_max_size (3rd argument)
266 must be sizeof(mpfr_prec_t). */
267 getLittleEndianData ((unsigned char *) &precision, buffer,
268 sizeof(mpfr_prec_t), precision_size);
269
270 return precision + (MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_PRECISION + 1);
271}
272
273/*
274 * buffer : OUT : store the kind of the MPFR number x, its sign, the size of
275 * its exponent and its exponent value in a binary format,
276 * can be null (may be reallocated if too small)
277 * buffer_size : IN/OUT : size of the buffer => size used in the buffer
278 * x : IN : MPFR number
279 * return pointer to a buffer storing the kind of the MPFR number x, its sign,
280 * the size of its exponent and its exponent value in a binary format,
281 */
282/* TODO
283 * Exponents that use more than 16 bytes are not managed (not an issue
284 * until one has integer types larger than 128 bits).
285 */
286static unsigned char*
287mpfr_fpif_store_exponent (unsigned char *buffer, size_t *buffer_size, mpfr_t x)
288{
289 unsigned char *result;
290 mpfr_uexp_t uexp;
291 size_t exponent_size;
292
293 exponent_size = 0;
294
295 if (MPFR_IS_PURE_FP (x))
296 {
297 mpfr_exp_t exponent = MPFR_GET_EXP (x);
298
299 if (exponent > MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT ||
300 exponent < -MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT)
301 {
302 mpfr_uexp_t copy_exponent, exp_sign_bit;
303
304 uexp = SAFE_ABS (mpfr_uexp_t, exponent)
305 - MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT;
306
307 /* Shift uexp to take the sign bit of the exponent into account.
308 Because of constraints on the valid exponents, this cannot
309 overflow (check with an MPFR_ASSERTD). */
310 copy_exponent = uexp << 1;
311 MPFR_ASSERTD (copy_exponent > uexp);
312 COUNT_NB_BYTE(copy_exponent, exponent_size);
313 MPFR_ASSERTN (exponent_size <= 16); /* see TODO */
314
315 /* Sign bit of the exponent. */
316 exp_sign_bit = (mpfr_uexp_t) 1 << (8 * exponent_size - 1);
317 MPFR_ASSERTD (uexp < exp_sign_bit);
318 if (exponent < 0)
319 uexp |= exp_sign_bit;
320 }
321 else
322 uexp = exponent + MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT;
323 }
324
325 result = buffer;
326 ALLOC_RESULT(result, buffer_size, exponent_size + 1);
327
328 if (MPFR_IS_PURE_FP (x))
329 {
330 if (exponent_size == 0)
331 result[0] = uexp;
332 else
333 {
334 result[0] = MPFR_EXTERNAL_EXPONENT + exponent_size;
335
336 putLittleEndianData (result + 1, (unsigned char *) &uexp,
337 sizeof(mpfr_exp_t), exponent_size);
338 }
339 }
340 else if (MPFR_IS_ZERO (x))
341 result[0] = MPFR_KIND_ZERO;
342 else if (MPFR_IS_INF (x))
343 result[0] = MPFR_KIND_INF;
344 else
345 {
346 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_NAN (x));
347 result[0] = MPFR_KIND_NAN;
348 }
349
350 /* Set the sign, even for NaN. */
351 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (x))
352 result[0] |= 0x80;
353
354 return result;
355}
356
357/*
358 * x : OUT : MPFR number extracted from the binary buffer
359 * fh : IN : file handler
360 * return 0 if successful
361 */
362/* TODO
363 * Exponents that use more than 16 bytes are not managed (this is not
364 * an issue if the data were written by MPFR with mpfr_exp_t not larger
365 * than 128 bits).
366 */
367static int
368mpfr_fpif_read_exponent_from_file (mpfr_t x, FILE * fh)
369{
370 mpfr_exp_t exponent;
371 mpfr_uexp_t uexp;
372 size_t exponent_size;
373 int sign;
374 unsigned char buffer[sizeof(mpfr_exp_t)];
375
376 if (fh == NULL)
377 return 1;
378
379 if (fread (buffer, 1, 1, fh) != 1)
380 return 1;
381
382 /* sign value that can be used with MPFR_SET_SIGN,
383 mpfr_set_zero and mpfr_set_inf */
384 sign = (buffer[0] & 0x80) ? MPFR_SIGN_NEG : MPFR_SIGN_POS;
385 /* Set the sign, even for NaN. */
386 MPFR_SET_SIGN (x, sign);
387
388 exponent = buffer[0] & 0x7F;
389 exponent_size = 1;
390
391 if (exponent > MPFR_EXTERNAL_EXPONENT && exponent < MPFR_KIND_ZERO)
392 {
393 mpfr_uexp_t exp_sign_bit;
394
395 exponent_size = exponent - MPFR_EXTERNAL_EXPONENT;
396
397 /* A failure is acceptable when the exponent starts with leading zeros,
398 even if it would fit in mpfr_exp_t (see format description). */
399 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exponent_size > 16 /* see TODO */ ||
400 exponent_size > sizeof(mpfr_exp_t)))
401 return 1;
402
403 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (fread (buffer, exponent_size, 1, fh) != 1))
404 return 1;
405
406 uexp = 0;
407 getLittleEndianData ((unsigned char *) &uexp, buffer,
408 sizeof(mpfr_exp_t), exponent_size);
409
410 /* Sign bit of the exponent. */
411 exp_sign_bit = uexp & ((mpfr_uexp_t) 1 << (8 * exponent_size - 1));
412
413 uexp &= ~exp_sign_bit;
414 uexp += MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT;
415 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (uexp > MPFR_EMAX_MAX && uexp > -MPFR_EMIN_MIN))
416 return 1;
417
418 exponent = exp_sign_bit ? - (mpfr_exp_t) uexp : (mpfr_exp_t) uexp;
419 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (! MPFR_EXP_IN_RANGE (exponent)))
420 return 1;
421 MPFR_SET_EXP (x, exponent);
422
423 exponent_size++;
424 }
425 else if (exponent == MPFR_KIND_ZERO)
426 MPFR_SET_ZERO (x);
427 else if (exponent == MPFR_KIND_INF)
428 MPFR_SET_INF (x);
429 else if (exponent == MPFR_KIND_NAN)
430 MPFR_SET_NAN (x);
431 else if (exponent <= MPFR_EXTERNAL_EXPONENT)
432 {
433 exponent -= MPFR_MAX_EMBEDDED_EXPONENT;
434 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (! MPFR_EXP_IN_RANGE (exponent)))
435 return 1;
436 MPFR_SET_EXP (x, exponent);
437 }
438 else
439 return 1;
440
441 return 0;
442}
443
444/*
445 * buffer : OUT : store the limb of the MPFR number x in a binary format,
446 * can be null (may be reallocated if too small)
447 * buffer_size : IN/OUT : size of the buffer => size used in the buffer
448 * x : IN : MPFR number
449 * return pointer to a buffer storing the limb of the MPFR number x in a binary
450 * format
451 */
452static unsigned char*
453mpfr_fpif_store_limbs (unsigned char *buffer, size_t *buffer_size, mpfr_t x)
454{
455 unsigned char *result;
456 mpfr_prec_t precision;
457 size_t nb_byte;
458 size_t nb_limb, mp_bytes_per_limb;
459 size_t nb_partial_byte;
460 size_t i, j;
461
462 precision = mpfr_get_prec (x);
463 nb_byte = (precision + 7) >> 3;
464 mp_bytes_per_limb = mp_bits_per_limb >> 3;
465 nb_partial_byte = nb_byte % mp_bytes_per_limb;
466 nb_limb = (nb_byte + mp_bytes_per_limb - 1) / mp_bytes_per_limb;
467
468 result = buffer;
469 ALLOC_RESULT(result, buffer_size, nb_byte);
470
471 putBigEndianData (result, (unsigned char*) MPFR_MANT(x),
472 sizeof(mp_limb_t), nb_partial_byte);
473 for (i = nb_partial_byte, j = (nb_partial_byte == 0) ? 0 : 1; j < nb_limb;
474 i += mp_bytes_per_limb, j++)
475 putLittleEndianData (result + i, (unsigned char*) (MPFR_MANT(x) + j),
476 sizeof(mp_limb_t), sizeof(mp_limb_t));
477
478 return result;
479}
480
481/*
482 * x : OUT : MPFR number extracted from the binary buffer, should have the same
483 * precision than the number in the binary format
484 * buffer : IN : limb of the MPFR number x in a binary format,
485 * buffer_size : IN/OUT : size of the buffer => size used in the buffer
486 * return 0 if successful
487 */
488static int
489mpfr_fpif_read_limbs (mpfr_t x, unsigned char *buffer, size_t *buffer_size)
490{
491 mpfr_prec_t precision;
492 size_t nb_byte;
493 size_t mp_bytes_per_limb;
494 size_t nb_partial_byte;
495 size_t i, j;
496
497 precision = mpfr_get_prec (x);
498 nb_byte = (precision + 7) >> 3;
499 mp_bytes_per_limb = mp_bits_per_limb >> 3;
500 nb_partial_byte = nb_byte % mp_bytes_per_limb;
501
502 if ((buffer == NULL) || (*buffer_size < nb_byte))
503 {
504 *buffer_size = 0;
505 return 1;
506 }
507 *buffer_size = nb_byte;
508
509 if (nb_partial_byte > 0)
510 {
511 memset (MPFR_MANT(x), 0, sizeof(mp_limb_t));
512 getBigEndianData ((unsigned char*) MPFR_MANT(x), buffer,
513 sizeof(mp_limb_t), nb_partial_byte);
514 }
515 for (i = nb_partial_byte, j = (nb_partial_byte == 0) ? 0 : 1; i < nb_byte;
516 i += mp_bytes_per_limb, j++)
517 getLittleEndianData ((unsigned char*) (MPFR_MANT(x) + j), buffer + i,
518 sizeof(mp_limb_t), sizeof(mp_limb_t));
519
520 return 0;
521}
522
523/* External Function */
524/*
525 * fh : IN : file hander
526 * x : IN : MPFR number to put in the file
527 * return 0 if successful
528 */
529int
530mpfr_fpif_export (FILE *fh, mpfr_t x)
531{
532 int status;
533 unsigned char *buf;
534 unsigned char *bufResult;
535 size_t used_size, buf_size;
536
537 if (fh == NULL)
538 return -1;
539
540 buf_size = MAX_VARIABLE_STORAGE(sizeof(mpfr_exp_t), mpfr_get_prec (x));
541 buf = (unsigned char*) mpfr_allocate_func (buf_size);
542 if (buf == NULL)
543 return -1;
544
545 used_size = buf_size;
546 buf = mpfr_fpif_store_precision (buf, &used_size, mpfr_get_prec (x));
547 used_size > buf_size ? buf_size = used_size : 0;
548 status = fwrite (buf, used_size, 1, fh);
549 if (status != 1)
550 {
551 mpfr_free_func (buf, buf_size);
552 return -1;
553 }
554 used_size = buf_size;
555 bufResult = mpfr_fpif_store_exponent (buf, &used_size, x);
556 if (bufResult == NULL)
557 {
558 mpfr_free_func (buf, buf_size);
559 return -1;
560 }
561 buf = bufResult;
562 used_size > buf_size ? buf_size = used_size : 0;
563 status = fwrite (buf, used_size, 1, fh);
564 if (status != 1)
565 {
566 mpfr_free_func (buf, buf_size);
567 return -1;
568 }
569
570 if (mpfr_regular_p (x))
571 {
572 used_size = buf_size;
573 buf = mpfr_fpif_store_limbs (buf, &used_size, x);
574 used_size > buf_size ? buf_size = used_size : 0;
575 status = fwrite (buf, used_size, 1, fh);
576 if (status != 1)
577 {
578 mpfr_free_func (buf, buf_size);
579 return -1;
580 }
581 }
582
583 mpfr_free_func (buf, buf_size);
584 return 0;
585}
586
587/*
588 * x : IN/OUT : MPFR number extracted from the file, its precision is reset to
589 * be able to hold the number
590 * fh : IN : file hander
591 * Return 0 if the import was successful.
592 */
593int
594mpfr_fpif_import (mpfr_t x, FILE *fh)
595{
596 int status;
597 mpfr_prec_t precision;
598 unsigned char *buffer;
599 size_t used_size;
600
601 precision = mpfr_fpif_read_precision_from_file (fh);
602 if (precision == 0) /* precision = 0 means an error */
603 return -1;
604 if (precision > MPFR_PREC_MAX)
605 return -1;
606 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (MPFR_PREC_MIN == 1); /* as specified */
607 mpfr_set_prec (x, precision);
608
609 status = mpfr_fpif_read_exponent_from_file (x, fh);
610 if (status != 0)
611 {
612 mpfr_set_nan (x);
613 return -1;
614 }
615
616 /* Warning! The significand of x is not set yet. Thus use MPFR_IS_SINGULAR
617 for the test. */
618 if (!MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x))
619 {
620 /* For portability, we need to consider bytes with only 8 significant
621 bits in the interchange format. That's OK because CHAR_BIT >= 8.
622 But the implementation is currently not clear when CHAR_BIT > 8.
623 This may have never been tested. For safety, require CHAR_BIT == 8,
624 and test/adapt the code if this ever fails. */
625 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (CHAR_BIT == 8);
626 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT ((MPFR_PREC_MAX + 7) >> 3 <= (size_t) -1);
627 used_size = (precision + 7) >> 3; /* ceil(precision/8) */
628 buffer = (unsigned char*) mpfr_allocate_func (used_size);
629 if (buffer == NULL)
630 {
631 mpfr_set_nan (x);
632 return -1;
633 }
634 status = fread (buffer, used_size, 1, fh);
635 if (status != 1)
636 {
637 mpfr_free_func (buffer, used_size);
638 mpfr_set_nan (x);
639 return -1;
640 }
641 status = mpfr_fpif_read_limbs (x, buffer, &used_size);
642 mpfr_free_func (buffer, used_size);
643 if (status != 0)
644 {
645 mpfr_set_nan (x);
646 return -1;
647 }
648 }
649
650 return 0;
651}
